byline.original: By SYDNEY EMBER and GRAHAM BOWLEY

abstract: Lawyers for Bill Cosby will call Bruce Castor, former Montgomery County district attorney, to testify as part of their strategy to defend actor in Pennsylvania case; prosecutors there have charged Cosby with sexual abuse for 2004 attack on Andrea Constand, but his lawyers maintain 2005 deal Castor made with Cosby to agree not  to prosecute him, is still binding.
lead_paragraph: Lawyers say the former Montgomery County district attorney, Bruce Castor, made a binding promise not to prosecute Mr. Cosby in the Andrea Constand case.

headline.main: Bill Cosby’s Lawyers Say Binding Promise in 2005 Should Prevent Prosecution
headline.print_headline: Cosby’s Lawyers Say Binding Promise in 2005 Should Prevent Prosecution

snippet: Lawyers say the former Montgomery County district attorney, Bruce Castor, made a binding promise not to prosecute Mr. Cosby in the Andrea Constand case.
